# Ship Performance in the Gulf of Guinea

## 1 Overview

The Gulf of Guinea is a crucial maritime hub, but ship performance is affected by environmental conditions, security risks, and regulatory factors. Strong currents, high humidity, and piracy impact navigation, fuel efficiency, and operational costs.

Key metrics such as vessel speed, fuel consumption, turnaround time, and security-related delays shape shipping efficiency. Understanding these factors is essential for optimizing operations and ensuring maritime security in the region.
